metadata.Title: CVE-2022-28285 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description: When generating the assembly code for MLoadTypedArrayElementHole, an incorrect AliasSet was used. In conjunction with another vulnerability this could have been used for an out of bounds memory read. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 91.8, Firefox < 99, and Firefox ESR < 91.8. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-28285` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: firefox - 1:1snap1-0ubuntu1 No subscription required thunderbird - 1:91.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1 thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1 thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1 xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1 xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1 xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1 No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:1snap1-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:91.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
